author: Detroit Free Press
title: Who's going to play centerfield for the Tigers?
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Who's going to play centerfield for the Tigers? Anthony Fenech , Detroit Free Press Published 5:32 p.m. ET Feb. 7, 2017 | Updated 2 minutes ago CLOSE x Share Collins, one of several Tigers at TigerFest at Comerica Park Saturday, said he wants to be everyday centerfielder. Video by Perry A. Farrell/DFP Will it be Collins? Or Mahtook? Or Jones? A combination of the three? Someone has to patrol the huge Comerica Park CF Aug 31, 2016; Detroit, MI, USA; JaCoby Jones hits a double in the ninth inning against the Chicago White Sox at Comerica Park. (Photo: Rick Osentoski, USA TODAY Sports) 
With spring training right around the corner, the Free Press is rolling out its spring preview in this space all week. Pitchers and catchers report to Tiger Town in Lakeland, Fla., on Feb. 14. Today: Who’s going to play centerfield? 
After trading Cameron Maybin, the Detroit Tigers will host a competition of question marks in centerfield. The contestants: Tyler Collins, JaCoby Jones, Mikie Mahtook and maybe others. 
Jones, a rookie, has the most upside of the bunch, but the team would prefer to get him some more minor league time at Triple-A Toledo. Collins seems better suited as a fourth outfielder and the Comerica Park outfield could present a challenge. Mahtook could be the odds-on favorite . 
The Tigers acquired him in a trade with the Rays in late January and they believe he will contribute at the big league level. Mahtook’s experience – though short – gives him the edge over Jones. In 2015, he hit .295 with nine home runs and a slugging percentage of .619 in 105 at bats. Last season, his numbers dropped with more playing time (.195, three home runs, .292 slugging in 185 at bats).
